diff_hunk:
@@ -422,6 +426,16 @@
 - name: normal(Tensor self, double mean, double std, Generator generator)
   self: zeros_like(grad)
 
+- name: normal(Tensor mean, double std, Generator generator)
+  mean: grad.type().zeros(mean.sizes())
+
+- name: normal(double mean, Tensor std, Generator generator)
+  std: grad.type().zeros(std.sizes())
+
+- name: normal(Tensor mean, Tensor std, Generator generator)
+  mean: grad.type().zeros(mean.sizes())
+  std: grad.type().zeros(std.sizes())
body: I'd say that it's surprising that these functions are differentiable. They either shouldn't be, or should be implemented as native reparametrized functions.
body_html: I'd say that it's surprising that these functions are differentiable. They either shouldn't be, or should be implemented as native reparametrized functions.
body_text: I'd say that it's surprising that these functions are differentiable. They either shouldn't be, or should be implemented as native reparametrized functions.
